etymologies: Old English (ge)wiht, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wicht and German Gewicht. The form of the word has been influenced by weigh

definitions: a body's relative mass or the quantity of matter contained by it, giving rise to a downward force; the heaviness of a person or thing

examples.text: he was at least 175 pounds in weight

shortDefinitions: body's relative mass or quantity of matter contained by it, giving rise to downward force

definitions: the force exerted on the mass of a body by a gravitational field.
shortDefinitions: force exerted on mass of body by gravitational field

definitions: the quality of being heavy

examples.text: as he came upstairs the boards creaked under his weight

shortDefinitions: quality of being heavy

definitions: a unit or system of units used for expressing how much an object or quantity of matter weighs
shortDefinitions: unit or system of units used for expressing how much object or quantity of matter weighs

definitions: a piece of metal known to weigh a definite amount and used on scales to determine how heavy an object or quantity of a substance is.
shortDefinitions: piece of metal known to weigh definite amount and used on scales

definitions: a heavy object, especially one being lifted or carried

examples.text: be careful when lifting a heavy weight

shortDefinitions: heavy object

definitions: a heavy object used to give an impulse or act as a counterweight in a mechanism.
shortDefinitions: heavy object used to give impulse or act as counterpoise in mechanism

definitions: a heavy object propelled by a shot-putter.
shortDefinitions: heavy object thrown by shot-putter

definitions: blocks or discs of metal or other heavy material used in weightlifting or weight training.
shortDefinitions: blocks or discs of metal or other heavy material used in weightlifting or weight training

definitions: the amount that a jockey is expected or required to weigh, or the amount that a horse can easily carry.
shortDefinitions: amount that jockey is expected or required to weigh, or amount that horse can easily carry

definitions: the ability of someone or something to influence decisions or actions

examples.text: a recommendation by the committee will carry great weight

shortDefinitions: ability of person or thing to influence decisions or actions

definitions: the importance attached to something

examples.text: individuals differ in the weight they attach to various aspects of a job

shortDefinitions: importance attributed to something

definitions: a factor associated with one of a set of numerical quantities, used to represent its importance relative to the other members of the set.
shortDefinitions: factor associated with one of set of numerical quantities

definitions: the surface density of cloth, used as a measure of its quality.
shortDefinitions: surface density of cloth, used as measure of its quality

phrases.text: be a weight off one's mind

definitions: hold (something) down by placing a heavy object on top of it

examples.text: a mug half filled with coffee weighted down a stack of papers

shortDefinitions: hold something down by placing heavy object on top of it

definitions: make (something) heavier by attaching a heavy object to it, especially so as to make it stay in place

examples.text: the jugs were covered with muslin veils weighted with colored beads

shortDefinitions: attach heavy object to something

definitions: attach importance or value to

examples.text: speaking, reading, and writing should be weighted equally in the assessment

shortDefinitions: attribute importance or value to

definitions: be planned or arranged so as to put a specified person, group, or factor in a position of advantage or disadvantage

examples.text: the balance of power is weighted in favor of the government

shortDefinitions: be planned or arranged so as to put specified person

definitions: multiply the components of (an average) by factors to take account of their importance.
shortDefinitions: multiply components of average by factors to take account of their importance

definitions: assign a handicap weight to (a horse).
shortDefinitions: assign handicap weight to

definitions: treat (a fabric) with a substance to make it seem thicker and heavier.
shortDefinitions: treat fabric with mineral to make it seem thicker and heavier

phrases.text: be a weight off one's mind
